STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
July 12, 2024
BRANDON HANNAH
CLARENCE FISCHER CENTER
1020 COMMERCE DR,
VASSAR, MI, 48768-9589
Re: License #: CI790363049
SI #: 2024SIC0001498
Dear Mr. Hannah:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Stephanie S Meeuwenberg, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2024SIC0001498
Special Investigation Intake Date: June 10, 2024
License #: CI790363049
Licensee Group Organization: Wolverine Human Services
Licensee Designee: Judith Fischer
Chief Administrator: BRANDON HANNAH
Agency Name: CLARENCE FISCHER CENTER
Agency Address: 1020 COMMERCE DR
VASSAR, MI 48768-9589
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 02/09/2026
Capacity: 60
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Date Contact Method Contact Purpose
6/10/2024 Email Other
6/10/2024 Email Other; Placement
6/10/2024 Email Other

6/13/2024 Email Documentation received or sent

7/1/2024 Video Conference MDHHS Disposition Meeting
1

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 6/8/24, youth was in the middle of a mental health crisis and
began attacking staff. When youth approached staff, the staff
struck the youth on the right side of the chin with their left fist.
Youth was taken to the hospital due to various injuries.
Investigation Interviews:
Program Manager was interviewed face-to-face at the facility
on June 12, 2024. Program Manager said he was called into work
on Saturday due to the incident with Youth A. Program Manager
said he reviewed the video footage and immediately sent Staff 1
home and called the information into MDHHS. Program Manager
said he was no present during the incident and does not have any
additional information.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on June
12, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth A arrived
at the interview with a black and blue right eye and when asked
how he received the injury he stated, “got hit on Saturday by [Staff
1]”. Youth A said he was upset, but cannot remember why, and
Staff 1 said “I’ll fight you” and then “clocked me” closed fist one
time in the face. Youth A said other staff were present but couldn’t
remember who they were. Youth A said he does not remember if
he hit Staff 1. Youth A said he had no prior issues with Staff 1
noting they got along “good”. Youth A said he does not remember
anything else Staff 1 said to him during the incident which ended
when the police arrived. Youth A said he has never seen Staff 1
become aggressive with other youth. Youth A said he has not had
any other issues with staff at the facility.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on June
12, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth B said he
has been placed on one-on-one staffing due to self-harm
2

behaviors and the staff consistently are supervising him. Youth B
said he does not have any staff that he does not like, noting Staff
1 is “really cool” and that he “likes him”. Youth B said on Saturday
he was playing basketball with Youth A and accidently elbowed
Youth A when he blocked his shot. Youth B said this make Youth A
very mad and he threw the basketball at him. Youth B said he left
the basketball court; Youth A followed him throwing rocks at him
and then grabbed a stick and began to threaten to hit him. Youth B
said he went back to unit four with his staff and Youth A followed
him and started to throw playing cards at his stomach and face.
Youth B said he was taken off unit four with his staff and Youth A
followed him and punched him. Youth B said staff got him into unit
three where Youth A was unable to follow him. Youth B said during
these incidents the staff were intervening and eventually had to
hold Youth A back, so he was able to get into unit four. Youth B
said once he was on unit three, he did not see Youth A again the
remainder of the night. Youth B said the following day he heard
that Staff 1 hit Youth A in the face. Youth B said he has never seen
Staff 1 upset so had a hard time believing it was true.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on June
12, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker.. Youth C said
things are going “okay” and that all staff are “good”. Youth C said
Staff 1 is a “good staff” and he has never had any issues with him.
Youth C said he did not have any issues with Youth A on Saturday.
Youth C said he did not see the interactions between Youth A and
Staff 1 however heard later that evening that Staff 1 hit Youth A
and gave him a “black eye”.
Staff 1 was interviewed via zoom on June 18, 2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 1 said he has been
employed since March 18, 2024, as a youth care specialist
working second shifts. Staff 1 said Saturday started as a “normal
day” at the beginning of his shift. Staff 1 said he was assigned to
work unit 3 however was quickly moved to be one of the staff
assigned to supervise Youth A, as he was on two-on-one staffing.
Staff 1 said he had a good bond with Youth A and had worked with
him several times at the facility and has sat at the hospital for
many hours with Youth A. Staff 1 said he was told Youth A had
issues during first shift and had made comments about causing
issues for second shift staff. Staff 1 said Youth A was outside and
became angry and continued to get more upset but would not talk
about why he was angry. Staff 1 said Youth A requested to go
back to unit 4 and so he was brought inside. Staff 1 said Youth A
began to throw playing cards at Youth B and then picked up a
three-ring binder and threw it at Youth B. Staff 1 said Youth B’s
3

staff took him off unit 4 which upset Youth A and he ran off the unit
after Youth B. Staff 1 said Youth B had gone out the back door and
Youth A followed and started to throw rocks towards Youth B. Staff
1 said Youth B was able to get into unit 3 with the door secured so
Youth A was unable to get to him. Staff 1 said Youth A got a brick
from outside and threatened to smash the door if staff would not
open it, so they opened the door and let Youth A back into the
facility. Staff 1 said Youth A went over to unit 3 door and began to
pound on the door and window screaming at Youth B. Staff 1 said
Youth A walked into the cafeteria, smashed the drinking fountain
off the wall, grabbed a metal piece from it, walked to unit 3 door
and used the metal to break the window out of unit 3 door. Staff 1
said he and Supervisor moved in front of the broken window to
prevent Youth A from cutting himself on the broken glass or getting
a piece of the glass. Staff 1 said Youth A “grabbed him up” and
then let go and walked away. Staff 1 said Youth A attempted to get
another piece of metal off the drinking fountain however
Supervisor stepped on the fountain to prevent him from getting
anymore pieces. Staff 1 said Youth A then went to the classroom
and grabbed a speaker with a cord and began to swing it around
at staff. Staff 1 said Youth A was “uncontrollable” so he “surprise
punched” Youth A straight on with a closed fist somewhere from
the neck up however he was not sure exactly where. Staff 1 said
he did not feel he had any other way to control Youth A as he was
swinging the speaker at staff. Staff 1 said Youth A fell to the
ground and grabbed his leg, so Staff 1 pulled his leg away from
Youth A and other staff helped move Youth A away from him. Staff
1 said he then went into the kitchen and Staff 3 and Supervisor
took Youth A outside. Staff 1 said he had taken his jacket off
during the incident because they are not allowed to restraint with a
sweatshirt on and he felt they were going to end up restraining
Youth A. Staff 1 said he was trained to use CPI and never trained
to punch or hit a youth. Staff 1 said he never witnessed or was a
part of a restraint at the facility so felt unsure of when he was
supposed to initiated a restraint. Staff 1 said he felt confused
regarding what he was trained and what he actually saw in
practice on shift, noting that they are trained in restraints but then
told not to restrain while on shift. Staff 1 said he was “one hundred
percent in the wrong and should not have punched him”.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on June 12,
2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 2 said on
Saturday she was working directly with Youth A as one of the staff
providing two to one supervision for him. Staff 2 said Staff 1 was
the other staff assigned to provide two on one supervision to Youth
A. Staff 2 said when she arrived to work at 2pm, Youth A was
4

outside and was having a difficult day. Staff 2 said Youth A was
upset and making statements about not wanting a two to one staff,
and that he was going to “beat their assess” referring to the
second shift staff working with him. Staff 2 said Youth A came back
inside to unit 4 and began to throw playing cards at Youth B. Staff
2 said Youth B walked away and Youth A then threw a binder at
Youth B’s head. Staff 2 said Youth B was taken off the unit and
Youth A ran off the unit to follow him. Youth A saw Youth B in unit
3, ran back to cafeteria area, broke the water fountain off the wall,
took a metal piece and began to hit the window on unit 3 door to
get to Youth B. Staff 2 said Youth A was able to break the window
of the door and Staff 1 and Supervisor moved in front of the door
to prevent Youth A from getting glass or into unit 3. Staff 2 said
Youth A punched Staff 1 and Supervisor and then walked away
from the unit 3 door. Staff 2 said Youth A went into the cafeteria
and began trying to get into “stuff”, making threats to “beat [Staff 1]
ass”, telling Staff 1 he hated him and said “fuck you” to Staff 1.
Staff 2 said Staff 1 was facing Youth A and removed his jacket.
Staff 2 said she thought Staff 2 had removed his jacket because it
is against policy to have anything with hoods or strings because it
can be dangerous during restraints if a youth pulls the hood over
staff’s head or pulls their hoodie strings. Staff 2 was focused on
trying to verbally deescalate Youth A when he ran at Staff 1 and
fell to the ground, stating Youth A “hit the floor hard”. Staff 2 said
Staff 1 was standing over Youth A repeatedly “pulling up his pants”
which she said gave indication of “fighting” in her experience. Staff
2 said Staff 1 was making statements such as “I’m not the one”
and “I don’t give a fuck about my job”. Staff 2 said Youth A got up
and ran outside and she and Staff 3 followed him. Staff 2 said
outside Youth A got a brick and threw it at the door which
shattered. Staff 2 said somehow Youth A found a pen on the
ground and stabbed it into Staff 3’s leg at the same time the police
and ambulance arrived. Staff 2 said Youth A was then taken to the
hospital. Staff 2 said she has never seen Staff 1 get upset
previously or have concerning interactions with any youth. Staff 2
said staff are not trained to be physically aggressive towards youth
but rather to remain professional and focus on deescalating the
youth.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on June 12,
2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 3 said he
worked from 2pm until 11:30pm on Saturday and was monitoring
Staff 1 and Staff 2 while they were interacting with Youth A. Staff 3
said Youth A is on a 2 staff supervision status due to his erratic
behaviors including violence and self-harm. Staff 3 said the
decision to have Staff 1 as one of the two staff working with Youth
5

A was because he had worked well with Youth A previously, had
more experience than other staff, and had a calm and quiet
presence. Staff 3 said Youth A was escalated when second shift
arrived and was in and out of the unit with staff following him for a
short period of time. Staff 3 said Youth A was upset with Youth C
who was placed on unit 3 and was making statements about
wanting to fight Youth C and going to the unit 3 door yelling
threats. Staff 3 said Youth A walked off the unit into the cafeteria,
knocked the drinking fountain off the wall, took a metal piece off it,
went back to unit 3 door and began to use the metal piece to hit
the window of the door. Staff 3 said Youth A was able to break the
window out of the door at which time Staff 1 and Supervisor stood
in front of the door in order to prevent Youth A from getting any of
the glass since he has a history of self-harm. Staff 3 said Youth A
punched Staff 1 in the stomach twice, then punched Supervisor at
which time he initiated a restraint however Youth A immediately
calmed down and walked away so he disengaged the hold. Staff 3
said Youth A walked into a school classroom, grabbed a speaker
off the desk that had a cord and began swinging it around by the
cord like “a helicopter”. Staff 3 said Youth A was threatening to hit
staff with the speaker therefore staff stepped back and Youth A
walked into the cafeteria. Staff 3 said Youth A said “I’m going to
fuck you up” to Staff 1, at which time Staff 1 took off his jacket and
said “I’m not the one”. Staff 3 said his impression of Staff 1
removing his coat was due to getting ready to go into a restraint
and staff are not supposed to restrain with hoodies as it could be
pulled over his head and would be unsafe. Staff 3 said his
interpretation of Staff 1 saying “I’m not the one” was him making it
known to Youth A he is not afraid to restrain him if needed. Staff 3
said he was standing to the side of Youth A and Youth A was
focused on Staff 1 so he took the opportunity to lean forward and
grab the speaker from Youth A and then threw it into a storage
area right behind him. Staff 3 said when he looked up Youth A was
hitting Staff 1 and then fell backward onto the ground. Staff 3 said
he did not see Staff 1 hit Youth A. Staff 3 said Youth A’s legs went
into the air and Staff 1 grabbed Youth A’s leg and was not letting
go. Staff 3 said he told Staff 1 to let go of Youth A’s legs and then
peeled Staff 1’s fingers off Youth A’s leg and Supervisor told Staff
1 to go into the kitchen. Staff 3 said Youth A went outside and he
followed him. Staff 3 said Youth A was making the statement “he
hit me” and Staff 3 said Youth A’s lip was bleeding. Staff 3 said
Youth A was very angry and grabbed bricks and broke the front
door. Staff 3 said he took Youth A’s right hand to prevent him from
grabbing glass from the door and Youth A grabbed a pen off the
ground and stabbed him in the leg at the same time police and
ambulance arrived. Staff 3 said Youth A was then taken to the
6

hospital. Staff 3 said the EMS treated him for being stabbed by the
pen and it breaking off in his leg. Staff 3 said he has never seen or
heard of any issues with Staff 1 previously. Staff 3 said staff are
not trained to use physical violence in working with youth.
Cook was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on June 12,
2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Cook said Youth A
was upset on Saturday and came into the cafeteria and “grabbed
the drinking fountain off the wall”. Cook said Supervisor put her
foot on the drinking fountain to prevent Youth A from picking it up
at which time Youth A punched Supervisor in the face, grabbed a
metal piece and ran down the hallway. Cook said she took care of
all the tables, chairs, and salad bar. Cook said Youth A returned to
the cafeteria with speaker on a cord and was spinning it around in
the air. Cook said one of the staff was able to get the speaker
away from Youth A and at the same time she heard Supervisor yell
“stop”. Cook said Staff 1 took off his coat, went up to Youth A and
punched him in the face. Cook said Supervisor pulled Staff 1 aside
and held him back from Youth A. Cook said Supervisor kept
saying “no, no” to Staff 1 and then she opened her kitchen door
and told Staff 1 “get your ass in here”. Cook said Staff 1 came into
the kitchen and she could tell his adrenaline was very high, so she
had him sit down and she gave him a drink. Cook said Staff 1
began to calm down and made the statement “I can’t stand to
watch anyone punch a woman” and “now I might not be able to
see my kids”. Cook said she has seen Staff 1 working with the
youth on occasion and he is usually very “laid back and quiet”.
Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
June 12, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker.
Supervisor said she worked Saturday from 2pm until 6pm.
Supervisor said when she arrived Youth A was outside and upset
making self-harm statements and threatening to beat up second
shift staff. Supervisor said Youth A was irritated and pacing around
the unit however refused to talk to any staff. Supervisor said Youth
A was on the unit with Youth B and staff asked if they wanted to
play cards and Youth A said yes, then took the cards and began to
throw them at Youth B. Supervisor said Youth B did not react so
Youth A grabbed more cards and continued to throw them at Youth
B. Supervisor said Youth B was taken off the unit and Youth A
chased him and attempted to punch Youth B. Supervisor said
Youth B was able to get into unit 3 with the door locked and Youth
A stood at the door pounding and screaming at Youth C.
Supervisor said she and Staff 1 stood in front of the door and
Youth A pushed her and then walked into the cafeteria. Supervisor
said Youth A smashed the drinking fountain, took a metal piece of
7

it, went to unit 3 door, and smashed out the window of the door.
Supervisor said she and Staff 1 stood in front of the broken
window to prevent Youth A from getting glass or reaching through
the window and cutting himself. Supervisor said Youth A pushed
her and punched Staff 1 in the stomach, at which point she called
911. Supervisor said she called for staff to place Youth A in a
restraint and Staff 1 and Staff 3 attempted but let go because
Youth A got loose and walked away. Supervisor said Youth A went
into a classroom and destroyed a computer and then grabbed the
speakers that were attached to the computer and began to swing
them around over his head. Supervisor said everyone stepped
back at that point to prevent getting hit. Supervisor said Youth A
walked back into the cafeteria and began swinging the speaker
and walked towards Staff 1. Supervisor said Staff 3 grabbed the
speaker from Youth A as he was not looking in his direction.
Supervisor said Staff 1 took off his coat and said, “I’m a grown ass
man, you’re not going to put your hands on me”. Supervisor said
she immediately ran towards Staff 1 intending to intervene
however Youth A fell backwards and hit the floor yelling that Staff 1
had hit him before she got to them. Supervisor said she did not
see Staff 1 punch Youth A but did see Staff 1’s arm go straight out
in a punching motion in front of him. Supervisor said she sent Staff
1 into the kitchen while she, Staff 2, and Staff 3 took Youth A
outside. Supervisor said Youth A continued to be upset and was
throwing bricks at the door and shattered the front door.
Supervisor said Youth A found a pen on the ground and stabbed
Staff 3 in the leg at the same time the police and EMS arrived.
Supervisor said Youth A saw the police and fell to the ground and
then was transported to the hospital by EMS. Supervisor said all
staff are trained to restrain using CPI and never to punch or harm
a youth. Supervisor said they were attempting to manage the
environment and called 911 for assistance, taking any items Youth
A grabbed when it was safe. Supervisor said Staff 1’s behavior
was out of character for him, and she has never seen him become
upset or frustrated in the past. Supervisor said she has never had
any issues with Staff 1, and he has been the one-to-one staff for
Youth A on several occasions. Supervisor said she does not know
why Staff 1 removed his sweatshirt which was part of the reason
she ran over to him as it seemed like odd behavior. Supervisor
said Staff 1 was sent home after the incident.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of June 8, 2024, cafeteria was reviewed on June
12, 2024. The entire video is seventeen seconds in length, the
events occurring very quickly. The video footage shows Youth A in
the cafeteria with Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3, and Supervisor. Youth A
8

has a cord in his hand with a computer speak on the end of the
cord. Youth A is facing Staff 1 and walks towards him. Staff 3 is
seen behind Youth A grabbing the speaker from him and tossing it
behind where they are standing. Supervisor is standing to the side
of Youth A on her cell phone. As Youth A walks towards Staff 1,
Staff 1 is seen removing his zip-up sweatshirt, tossing it to the
ground, pulls his pants up, and takes a few steps back. Youth A is
seen walking quickly towards Staff 1 at which time Staff 1 holds
Youth A back with his right hand, pulls his left hand back and
punches Youth A with a closed fist and Youth A falls to the ground.
Supervisor and Staff 3 are both seen walking quickly towards
Youth A and Staff 1 while this is occurring. Once Youth A is on the
floor Staff 1 has his foot and Supervisor is seen moving Staff 1
away from Youth A as Staff 2 and Staff 3 intervene with Youth A.
Documents Reviewed:
• Youth A’s safety plan dated May 31, 2024, was reviewed.
The safety plan required two to one staffing for Youth A
during waking hours and one to one staffing while Youth A
is asleep. The safety plan outlines Youth A’s triggers,
warning signs of becoming unsafe, staff interventions, and
Youth A’s restrictions.
• Youth A’s medical records from McLaren Health Care dated
June 8, 2024. The documentation states Youth A “was in a
physical altercation, injury to right eye, lip and shoulder”.
• Wolverine Human Services Risk Prevention Management
Policy was reviewed. The policy does not allow for any use
of physical discipline of youth or punching youth. The policy
outlines the expectations of staff to intervene in critical
incidents by assessing the situation, relocating other youth
if necessary, contacting supervisors and police if necessary,
and utilizing CPI restraint model for de-escalation and
restraint if needed.
• Staff 2’s witness statement dated June 8, 2024, which is
consistent with her interview.
• Staff 3’s witness statement dated June 8, 2024, which is
consistent with his interview.
• Incident Report for Youth A dated June 8, 2024. The
incident report is consistent with staff interviews of the
events of the evening that resulted in Staff 1 punching
Youth A.
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record
and Staff 1 completed the required CPI training on March
27, 2024. In addition, Staff 1 signed a document titled
“Punitive Measures” where it outlines prohibited behaviors
9

including “use of physical discipline inflicted in any
manner”.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as per video review, youth
interviews, and staff interviews, Staff 1 punched Youth A in the
face which is prohibited.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR2023C0000074 dated 2/7/23, CAP Approved 2/24/23
SIR2023C0000496 dated 8/8/23, CAP Approved 8/29/23
SIR2024C0000928SI dated 1/5/24, CAP Approved 2/1/24
SIR2024SIC0001255 dated 5/13/24, CAP Approved 6/3/24
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
_____________________________________July 9, 2024_
Stephanie S Meeuwenberg Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
